description: Handle requests and return responses using Function-Based and Class-Based Views.

slides.title: What is a View?
slides.content:
# The Logic Layer üß†

A View is a Python function (or class) that takes a Web Request and returns a Web Response.

It contains the business logic of your application.

slides.title: Function-Based Views (FBV)
slides.content:
# Simple & Explicit üìú

`views.py`:

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
from django.http import HttpResponse

def my_view(request):
    return HttpResponse("Hello World")
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: URL Configuration
slides.content:
# The Dispatcher üö¶

`urls.py` maps URLs to views.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
from django.urls import path
from . import views

urlpatterns = [
    path('hello/', views.my_view),
]
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Dynamic URLs
slides.content:
# Capturing Values üé£

Use angle brackets to capture parameters.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
# urls.py
path('post/<int:id>/', views.post_detail)

# views.py
def post_detail(request, id):
    return HttpResponse(f"Post ID: {id}")
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Rendering Templates
slides.content:
# Returning HTML üñºÔ∏è

Use the `render()` shortcut.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
from django.shortcuts import render

def home(request):
    return render(request, 'home.html', {'name': 'Alice'})
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Config Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which file is responsible for mapping URL patterns to view functions?

slides.title: Class-Based Views (CBV)
Generic Views
slides.content:
# Write Less Code ‚ö°

`ListView`, `DetailView`, `CreateView`, etc.

<!-- FULL_CODE_START
from django.views.generic import ListView
from .models import Person

class PersonList(ListView):
    model = Person
    template_name = 'person_list.html'
FULL_CODE_END -->

slides.title: Shortcuts
slides.content:
# Helper Functions üõ†Ô∏è

- `render()`: Renders a template.
- `redirect()`: Returns an HTTP redirect.
- `get_object_or_404()`: Gets an object or raises 404.

slides.title: Namespaces
slides.content:
# Organizing URLs üè∑Ô∏è

If you have multiple apps, use `app_name`.

`urls.py`: `app_name = 'polls'`

Template: `{% url 'polls:detail' %}`

slides.title: Decorators
View Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which shortcut function returns a 404 error if an object with the given criteria usually found by 'get()' does not exist?

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Views üïµÔ∏è

The Controller logic.

- **FBV:** Simple functions.
- **CBV:** Reusable classes (`ListView`).
- **URLs:** Map paths to views (`urls.py`).
- **Shortcuts:** `render`, `redirect`.
